abstract: Streams and rivers in the United States alone release almost 100 million metric tons of carbon dioxide each year -- equal to a car burning 40 billion gallons of gasoline, "enough to drive back and forth to the moon 3.4 million times," a study says.
snippet: Streams and rivers in the United States alone release almost 100 million metric tons of carbon dioxide each year -- equal to a car burning 40 billion gallons of gasoline, "enough to drive back and forth to the moon 3.4 million times," a study says.

keywords.name: unknown
keywords.value: Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies

lead_paragraph: The amount of carbon dioxide being released from streams, rivers and lakes is probably being undercounted by scientists modeling the earth's carbon budget, a new study suggests.

headline.main: A Carbon Culprit: Rivers and Streams
